meta_notice_top: IMPORTANT: At the end of the file you will find the marker [END OF FILE]. If it is missing, the file was not fully loaded.
author: Johannes Glaser
description: Templates for central nutritionOS files (nutrition log, food category files, recipes, supplements). This file contains no data and serves as a blueprint when creating new logs or databases.

meta.note: This file contains only templates/schemas. It is not used directly as a log.

global_rules.description: General rules for using these templates.
assistant_instructions: - When using one of these templates to create a concrete log or data file (e.g., nutrition_log.json, nut_butter.json, recipes.json, supplements.json):
• First write the standard header/meta block of the target file.
• Immediately below it, insert the matching template from this file as the first entry.
• Only then append the actual 'real' entries.
- The template functions as in-file schema documentation and makes later write actions easier.
- When analysing logs or databases, the template entry must be treated as a schema/example entry, not as real data.
- nutritionOS may skip or specially mark this entry internally.

template_nutrition_log.description: Template for nutrition_log.json – daily entries with macro balance.

meta.description: Nutrition log with daily entries, including macro balance, plant diversity, and fruit/vegetable portions.

list_of_items: Food or meal (kcal, g protein, g fat, g carbohydrates)

template_food_category.description: Template for a categorised food file (e.g., nut butter, yogurt, plant milk, carbohydrates, shakes). Can be used as a workaround DB or as a standalone category file.

meta.description: Database for a food category (e.g., nut butter, (plant) yogurt, (plant) milk, shakes, carbohydrates).

template_recipes.description: Template for recipes.json – collection of recipes with ingredients, preparation and nutrient data.

ingredients.food_ref: Reference to food entry or free text

template_supplements.description: Template for supplements.json – optional tracking of supplements.

meta.description: Supplement log for contextualising nutrition and training.
